explanations.A: Starting in the units column on the right: 6 − 8 can't be done, so we need to use a ten from the tens column to do 16 − 8 = 8. The second column now has 0 in the top row and 2 beneath. We can't work out 0 − 2, so we use a 1 from the hundreds column to give 10 − 2 = 8, so ★ = 8
explanations.B: It looks like you added the 1 and 2. But we need to subtract and we need to start from the units column on the right to see if we need to borrow anything from the tens column first.
explanations.C: It looks like you took the 1 away from the 2. But we can't switch the numbers around - we have to take the number in the second row away from the number in the first row (so 1 - 2, not 2 - 1 in this column). If the subtraction is not possible, we can take some more from the next column.
explanations.D: It looks like you might have carried a ten over from the units column and added it in to give 1 - 2 + 1 = 0. Remember that we need to complete the subtraction in the units column before we can work out the tens column.
